channel.title: Radio Go Daddy Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: With your host, Bob Parsons
channel.itunes:author: Radio Go Daddy
channel.itunes:summary: Radio Go Daddy -- is a weekly radio show and podcast hosted by Bob Parsons, CEO & Founder of GoDaddy.com. The show is broadcast every Wednesday at 2 pm PST/5 pm EST -- live from Go Daddy's Scottsdale headquarters and streamed from the www.radiogodaddy.com web site. Each installment features a special guest -- ranging from leading Internet entrepreneurs to start-up innovators to controversial newsmakers -- plus a segment called "Internet Files" during which Parsons and his expert panel review and discuss the top tech stories of the week. Detailed descriptions of prior shows can be found at www.radiogodaddy.com, together with free downloads to iPODs, MP3 players and personal computers. Transcripts are also available for download, free of charge. Go Daddy is a leading provider of services that enable individuals and businesses to establish, maintain and evolve an online presence. GoDaddy.com is known for competitive pricing, quality products, and industry leading customer service. The company is also known for its edgy Super Bowl advertisements featuring Danica Patrick, Candice Michelle, Dale Earnhardt Jr., and others.

item.title: Curtains for Radio Go Daddy + The Best of the Worst of 2009, Part II
item.description: This is it! After almost four crazy years on the air, we have reached the final installment of Radio Go Daddy! On tap for this very special occasion: Part II of our 2009 Retrospective. So prepare yourself to re-experience the eerie predictions of loopy clairvoyant Sylvia Browne and author Dave Cullen's stunning revelations about what really happened before, during and after the Columbine massacre. Also on the menu: Comedian Jon Reep's hilarious "Rules For The Locker Room," plus a conservative broadside against the Left -- courtesy of Ann Coulter and Michelle Malkin! On that note: Thanks for lending us an ear. It's been a blast!

item.title: Re-Experience the Very Best of Radio Go Daddy 2009!
item.description: It's the end of an era, people! We're going off the air for good. But before Radio Go Daddy enters the pantheon of late great radio shows, we have a special treat for you: A two-part tour de force of the very best - and worst - of Radio Go Daddy 2009! So tune in, hang loose and prick up your ears for Part I, which serves up that legendary appearance by bona fide madman Ted Nugent, the rants of combustible comedian Adam Carolla, and the unforgettable -- and epically vitriolic -- "Guy From Boston." And let's not forget LaToya's Jackson's lament to her late great brother and a certain mystery guest that made Nima all mushy! And much more!

item.title: Holy Toledo, Batman! Relive the Great Adam West on Radio Go Daddy!
item.description:
To the Batmobile, bat fans! Fasten your bat seat belts for a very special encore presentation of the original Caped Crusader -- the great Adam West -- entertaining Bob & Crew with intimate anecdotes from the bat cave, including the truth about Cesar -- The Joker -- Romero's mustache and that electrifying sexual tension between the purring Catwoman and the growling Batman. Mr. West also reveals how his hilarious Family Guy gig almost earned him a fatwa! And on The Internet Files, a British school girl gets so sick of her granny's moaning that she tries to sell her on eBay!
Also on tap: Britain asks Governator Schwarzenegger to "terminate" the Calif-based "TripAdvisor for Pimps" Web site!

item.title: We Love Them Long Time - Relive Raunchy Rap Renegades 2 Live Crew!
item.description: The show was legendary! So we're giving you a chance to relive one of Bob's all-time favorite installments of Radio Go Daddy -- and one of the raunchiest ones, too! That's right: It's 2 Live Crew in da house as the scandalous rappers give us a taste of their new material and reminisce about their glory days and that awesome "Me So Horny" masterpiece of theirs! And on The Internet Files, Warren fills us in on the difference between "good" and "bad" hackers. Plus: With local Internet connections slow as molasses, carrier pigeons could be back in business in South Africa!

item.title: The Outrageous Ralphie May Rips Oprah & Michael Jackson. Plus: A Lewd New Low for the Internet Files!
item.description:
Nothing is sacred to shameless heavyweight comedian Ralphie May, who -- in a very special encore presentation of one of our most scandalous shows ever -- entertains Bob & Co. with his hilarious take on Michael Jackson's legacy, how he prefers his Oprah & why Paula Dean turns him on! And in The Internet Files, a moronic burglar checks his Facebook® account on victim's computer, but forgets to log out. And this was also the episode in which one story made us crack up so hard we almost couldn't finish the show. Hint: It had to do with cyber toys for the virtual bedroom.
Plus: Tales from Bob's epic cross-country motorcycle ride.

item.title: Spineless Liberals Turn Coldblooded Terrorists Into Victims, Ann Coulter Rages!
item.description: Those bleeding-heart liberals insist on turning everyone -- even hardcore terrorists -- into victims, our guest, conservative icon and agitator extraordinaire Ann Coulter, claims in a rapid-fire broadside against the Left. And, she fumes, this spineless surrender mentality is exactly why the Army and everyone else failed to act on the chilling rhetoric from Fort Hood massacre suspect Maj. Hasan! And on The Internet Files, the panelists discuss Google's plans to double Internet speeds with a new application-layer protocol. Also on the menu: Conspiracy theorists and other nuts believe the world will come to a cataclysmic end on Dec. 21, 2012. So can we kiss our earthly lives goodbye?

item.title: Sen. Fred Thompson Warns of the Dangers of Trying the Sept. 11th Mastermind in NYC!
item.description: Trying Khalid Sheikh Mohammed in New York is a huge mistake, and the inevitable media circus will hand the Sept. 11th mastermind a very public pulpit from which to preach his vile propaganda. That's the disturbing warning from our guest, the esteemed Sen. Fred Thompson, who also claims that some of the documents handed over to Mohammed's defense went straight to Osama Bin Laden's tent! And on The Internet Files, the panelists try to make sense of a new study, which claims that Internet usage makes you more social. And a warped new computer game permanently deletes a random file from your Mac every time you pulverize an alien! Plus: Playboy's Scott Alexander presents the hottest tech gifts for the Holiday season!

item.title: Adam Carolla Eviscerates the ACLU & How a GPS Receiver Saved Bob's Behind!
item.description: He is cranky, volatile and absolutely hilarious. He's even got an asteroid named after him! In a very special encore presentation of Radio Go Daddy, we're replaying one of our funniest shows ever as combustible comedian Adam Carolla entirely loses his cool and goes on an epic tirade that ridicules navel-gazing tweets and absolutely eviscerates the ACLU, which, he claims, is destroying our country! And on the Internet Files, we reveal how one brainy house cat landed a high school diploma. Also on tap: New study proves what's painfully obvious: Half of all tweets are nothing but mindless babble! Plus: How a GPS receiver saved Bob from the jaws of a ferocious leopard!

item.title: What Are John Lennon & Michael Jackson Up To? Psychic Sylvia Browne Connects With the Beyond & Prophesizes on Doom.
item.description: John Lennon and Michael Jackson are performing divine concerts in Heaven, and Farrah Fawcett has gone into research! So speaks our guest, world-famous psychic Sylvia Browne. The seeress also predicts a massive recovery of the US economy and assures us that no meteorite impact or other cataclysmic natural disaster will wipe out Mankind anytime soon! And in The Internet Files, the panelists examine the "tweeting-after-sex" phenomenon. We also have the strange tale of the NYU researcher who's translating Moby Dick in its entirety into Japanese emoticons. Plus: Balloon Boy video games, nude burglars & Susan Fitter's latest lecture on netiquette!

item.title: TV's Sexy "Money Honey" and Web Celeb Hotty iJustine
item.description: Maria Bartiromo made it to the top of a heavily male-dominated world. But does CNBC's original "Money Honey" cringe when she hears that nickname? Or does she kinda like it? You will never guess why she trademarked the term! Maria also delivers her sobering take on the troubled economy: Is there light at the end of the tunnel, or are we only halfway through a devastating "double-dip recession"? Also joining Bob & Co: Web hottie Justine Ezarik -- aka "iJustine" -- reveals why creepy stalkers forced her to stop "lifecasting" her every waking moment on the Internet and how the phenomenal power of YouTube inspires millions to watch her order pizza or flip through a phone bill. And on which hit TV show will she be making a brief, but bloody appearance? On the Internet Files, the panelists learn which country made high-speed Internet a legal right and hear the chilling story of how an iPhone saved a Vermont woman from the jaws of a ferocious bear. Plus: Owen Thomas lets loose on the alleged inside trader and fired Twitter boss's new start-up.

item.title: La Toya Says Michael Knew He Was Going To Die... And Why. Plus: Kiss & Tell on Google Maps and Tweets From The Afterlife!
item.description: "Michael was a gift from God" -- an absolutely wonderful human being. But justice needs to be served following his tragic and unnecessary death! That's the message from an emotional La Toya Jackson. In an absolutely extraordinary show, a painfully honest La Toya opens up to Bob about Michael's legacy, her theory about his untimely death -- and her best-selling Playboy spreads. Also on the menu: Gayle Bass -- aka the "Click Chick" from KTAR Radio -- joins the cast and tells the crew where to see stories of leprechauns in Alabama and chimpanzees riding Segways! On the Internet Files a tasteful new website lets you pinpoint on a Google Map where, how and when you just did the nasty and our panelists reach a stunning new low as they discuss "twéances," "twairvoyances,""twasturbation" and other ridiculous Twitter twenomena! Plus: The ever-vicious Owen Thomas explains how one Silicon Valley exec uses Wikipedia to bed women!

item.title: Liberal Cry Babies, Locker Room Nudity & Gunfire in the Apple Store!
item.description: Is it OK to get naked in the gym locker room? As long as you follow the "5-minute rule" says our guest and Last Comic Standing winner Jon Reep. Jon also tells us what you should NEVER do with a hair dryer. Plus, Republican advisor and political commentator Mary Matalin blasts Pres. Obama's track record and slams liberal men who don't fight fair. In the Internet Files: computer makers plan to release an "instant-on" PC and why you shouldn't shoot your iPhone in the Apple store. And: Nik the Geek sings the praises of the Hello Kitty iPhone app and reveals embarrassing photos of Bob!

item.title: Batman/Family Guy's ADAM WEST! Plus TripAdvisor 4 Pimps and Selling Granny on eBay
item.description: Zapp!!! Kapoww!!! Bamm!!! Holy Sound Effects, Batfans: In a truly legendary show, the great Adam West joins Bob & Co. from the Batcave to entertain you with anecdotes from the Bat set, his co-starring role with The Three Stooges and how his new Family Guy gig almost earned him a Fatwa. Adam also gives the scoop on that Batcave garage sale and the new "Adam West Naked" DVD, which features the Caped Crusader telling all about every 120 "Batman" episodes. Plus, will the Dark Knight kiss and tell on who he lured into the Bat bedroom? Tune in to find out! And in the Internet Files, the panelists wonder what made a British school girl auction her granny on eBay. A no reserve auction at that! We also have the lowdown on why Britain wants Arnold Schwarzenegger to "terminate" the Calif-based "TripAdvisor for Pimps" Web site that posts reviews on London's prostitutes! Plus: Susan Fitter attempts to explain why flaming each other on the Web is a no-no!

item.title: Comic Ralphie May's Rants on Oprah & Michael Jackson!
item.description:
He's outrageous, politically incorrect, and funny as hell! Nothing is sacred to our guest, the "Austin-tatious," larger-than-life comedian Ralphie May, who, in a show for the ages, entertains Bob & Co. with his hilariously irreverent take on Oprah, the hot women of the Food Network, Michael Jackson's legacy & smoking weed with JC! Also on the menu: Pro Bull Rider Cody Ford dishes on rodeo groupies and mounting a 2100 lb. bull! And in the Internet Files, an epically idiotic burglar checks Facebook account on victim's computer, but forgets to log out. And -- it finally happened -- one story made the panelists laugh so hard they almost couldn't finish the show. You gotta hear it!
Plus: Susan Fitter's netiquette advice and Owen Thomas points the finger at an alleged Pyramid scheme!

item.title: The Disturbing Truth About the Columbine Massacre
item.description: When Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold slaughtered 13 people and then themselves at Columbine High School, the media helped create an image of the killers as reclusive outcasts who snapped after years of bullying. Not true, says Dave Cullen, author of NYT Bestseller "Columbine," who's on a mission to set the record straight about the tragedy. There was, he tells Bob in a jaw-dropping interview, no "Trench Coat Mafia," and the perpetrators were coldblooded, calculating killers determined to murder hundreds of random students and school personnel. And on the Internet Files, the esteemed panelists discuss how Microsoft's new Visual Search service will work for X-rated material, while Bob finds the positive in Denmark's embarrassingly ill-advised tourism ad. Plus: Owen Thomas gives a one-two punch at Tesla Motors and Facebook!

item.title: Bob Love Them Long Time -- 2 Live Crew in da House!
item.description: Their raunchy lyrics and suggestive videos put Miami rappers 2 Live Crew squarely on the frontline of the late 80s/early 90s rap censorship war. In a show that's bound to up Radio Go Daddy's street cred, the infamous rappers reminisce about "Me So Horny," give a sneak peak of their latest single and unleash their unfiltered take on strip clubs, censorship and, even, Danica Patrick! And in the Internet Files, the pundits try to understand why 2 trapped girls updated their Facebook for help instead of calling for help. Also on tap: Carrier pigeons make a triumphant return in South Africa, and should email messages in BOLD, RED and ALL CAPS really be grounds for termination? Plus: Nik the Geek reviews the new iPod & Owen Thomas spits more venom at Silicon Valley CEOs!

item.title: Madoff's Obsessions, Buzz Aldrin's Amazing Final Thought Before Moonwalk
item.description: Bernie Madoff pulled off one of the biggest swindles in history by shamelessly ripping off friends, celebs, charities, even unsuspecting relatives. "Madoff with the Money" author Jerry Oppenheimer reveals how Madoff's life of deceit can be traced all the way back to his childhood in Queens and exposes his rampant obsessive compulsiveness, secret sex affairs and personal quirks including wearing two $30K Rolexes on the same wrist. Also on the menu, AdventureGirl -- aka Stephanie Michaels -- reveals Buzz Aldrin's unbelievable last thought before stepping on the moon and explains how she racked up a whopping 1 million Twitter followers! And in the Internet Files, the pundits weigh in on the new Twitter parody, Woofer.com, and the iPhone exclusive is running out for AT&T. And although marginally intrigued, Bob & Co. are mostly split on the authenticity of the "Nessie" sighting on Google Earth. Plus: Owen Thomas resurfaces & Nik the Geek hands down the verdict on Apple's new Snow Leopard OS

item.title: How to Date Out Of Your League & Michelle Malkin Blasts Obama's Washington
item.description: Obama's message of Hope and Change is a hoax, and voters are facing a serious case of buyer's remorse! At least that's what our guest, conservative blogger and #1 NY Times Bestselling author Michelle Malkin claims in her devastating expose on the Obama Administration, which, she alleges, is infested with corruption and cronyism. Also on tap: A peek inside the awesome life of "The Imbiber -- aka Playboy blogger Dan Dunn -- who enlightens us on what it takes to date way out of your league. And in the Internet Files, our esteemed panelists ponder how the infamous "Skank blogger" suddenly became the victim! Meanwhile, the Swiss are angry with Google, the Brazilians try eCards to stop the spread of STDs, and the French speed up divorce proceedings by using steamy SMS. Plus, Susan Fitter educates Web heathens on proper netiquette and Nik the Geek takes the new Kindle for a spin!

item.title: Adam Carolla Goes Off On Twitter, Swine Flu and Allergies
item.description: Bob's back with a vengeance! And in a legendary show, he fills Nima and co-host Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff in on his almost fatal African safari and how a GPS saved his ass. Literally. Meanwhile, radio host, comedian and exceptionally cranky Adam Carolla let's it fly on everything from the ACLU to Dancing With The Stars. And in the Internet Files, the distinguished panelists give the facts to back up what you already knew: Almost half of all tweets consist of mindless babble. Also on tap, Oreo the cat gets her high school diploma, and the stats on the typical gamer. Plus: More HamCam footage from Radio Go Daddy's inner sanctum.

item.title: Ted Nugent on Radio Go Daddy: Relive The Magic That is "The Nuge"
item.description: "The harder the hunt, the more delicious the meat!" Who, but the Motor City Madman himself, would say such a thing? By popular demand, we are replaying one of our greatest shows ever. Listen with your mouth open as the one and only Ted Nugent gives you a personal look into his bow hunting, cooking and wilderness survival. This, of course, is also the show in which "Uncle Ted" enlists Nima as prey to be hunted on his new wilderness survival reality TV show! And in the Internet Files, a naughty teen peddles nude pictures of his mom online while a DVD mishap gets a California teacher's students a first-row seat to her sexual exploits. Plus, Bob & Owen Thomas dissect the Netscape co-founder's new gig & more HamCam footage.

item.title: Surviving a Robot Uprising, the best use of Album Covers and Where's Chocolate Rain When You Need It?!
item.description:
Save yourselves from an inevitable robot attack! That's the chilling message from Dr. Daniel Wilson, roboticist and author of the tongue-in-cheek "How to Survive a Robot Uprising." Also joining Nima & guest host Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff: Comedienne Sarah Colonna from E!'s very funny "Chelsea Lately" gives her take on The Real Housewives of New Joisey, belching on the first date and so much more. On the Internet Files learn why Mark wants to get his hands on the SI SwimSuit iPhone app and why no matter how much Nima may loathe it, that YouTube wedding video isn't going anywhere fast! Plus: Owen Thomas blows the lid off of Silicon Valley narcissism and Nima and Mark span the globe for this week's weirdest news!

item.title: The Creator Descends on Radio Go Daddy & Mysteries of the Playboy Grotto Revealed!
item.description:
In a show that reaches for the heavens yet remains firmly planted in the gutter, the Creator himself -- aka Mr. Deity -- aka Brian Dalton -- descends on Radio Go Daddy to enlighten Nima & guest host Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff on what he would have done differently if he could do that whole Genesis thing all over again. Meanwhile, Playboy Tech Editor Scott Alexander previews the Apple Tablet PC and spills secrets from the famous Playboy Grotto! And in The Internet Files, after a worker at a Chinese iPhone plant leaped to his death from the factory's 12th floor the company consoles his girlfriend with a free laptop. Also on tap, our pundits doubt the Microsoft-Yahoo partnership won't even rattle Google -- and will the Queen's manservant tweet the Royal Flush?
Plus: Owen Thomas reports on out-of-control Silicon CEOs.

item.title: Naked Nun, Free AK-47s & Donny Osmond Shares His Last Conversations With Michael Jackson
item.description:
Irreverent guest host Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff may talk about birthmarks and harnesses and question her NYC street cred but if you ever wondered what would get Nima truly flustered and off her game, the answer is right here as she meets her idol Donny Osmond who shares his heart-breaking last conversations with lifelong friend Michael Jackson! Also on tap: Hacking superstar & ex-con Kevin Mitnick delivers a chilling primer on social networking! And on the Internet Files, the panelists explain the connection between God, free AK-47s & pickup trucks and wonder how an aspiring nun's nude picture may impact life behind monastery walls! Plus: Owen Thomas on why Tesla CEO Elon Musk finds him the meanest person in Silicon Valley!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved. No hamsters were harmed here, we promise!

item.title: Radio Go Daddy Joins the Dark Side -- With Warped Guest Host Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff!
item.description:
If you thought Radio Go Daddy would lose its edge in Bob's absence, think again!. With guest host Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff sitting in with Nima Jones, the show crosses into uncharted territory as we cover brick-hurling retirees, attachment sizes & the USB gadget that's sure to spice up air travel! Meanwhile, Cali Lewis of GeekBrief.TV feels the force with this Xmas' new Star Wars toy that teaches you to levitate stuff like a true Jedi! And in The Internet Files, Mark explains why Twitter is perfect for Britain's Royal Family and why a Chinese-style boot camp is the only cure for Web addiction. Also on tap: Bill Gates sets his sights on changing the weather! Plus: Owen Thomas has the lowdown on the Google CEO's latest adventures below the belt. And what is a ziggurat?

item.title: X-Rated Wildlife Pix & Mini-Me: Inside the Twisted Mind of Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff!
item.description:
What do Sarah Palin, Mini-Me and X-rated elephant pictures have in common? Well, they're all fueling the twisted mind of Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff who joins Bob to offer his warped take on politics, sex tapes & edgy wildlife photography! Meanwhile, Bob bluntly dismisses the Twitter® bid for the Nobel Peace Price and wonders if "Little Elvis" might be behind those recent cyberattacks. And in the Internet Files, the crew checks out the new smile cam that verifies that Japanese railroad workers, really, really like their jobs and marvels at the idiocy that blew the cover of Britain's new spy chief. Also, a medical marijuana dispensary goes Web 2.0 and starts tweeting its weed! Plus: Why is the Cisco CEO making duck calls from the corner office?

item.title: Radio Go Daddy Goes Primal -- With the Motor City Madman!
item.description:
"The harder the hunt, the more delicious the meat!" In an instant classic of a show, we're joined by the Nuge... the one and only Ted Nugent. That's right: the Motor City Madman explains the fine art of bow hunting & previews the new TV show in which "Uncle Ted" teaches people wilderness survival skills, then hunts them down! And in the Internet Files, a naughty New Zealand teen peddles nude pictures of his mom online while a DVD mishap forces California parents to stay up late teaching their kids about the birds & bees! Plus, Bob & Owen Thomas dissect the Netscape co-founder's new gig & more HamCam footage.
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved. No hamsters were harmed here, we promise!

item.title: Bob Gets Close With YouTube Sensation Marina Orlova
item.description:
When someone says "word origins", what's the first thing that comes to mind? A hot blonde, right? It is if you're one of the 230,000 subscribers to Marina Orlova's YouTube channel! The sexy Russian from hotforwords.com visits with Bob. Also on deck: Nik the Geek bangs heads with Bob about the new iPhone app "Documents To Go", Owen Thomas reveals that now Googles plans to go beneath the Earth and more HamCam action! And, in the Internet Files: The Pentagon sidesteps questions about new CyberCommand and can a Web addresses really save the environment?! Plus: Ham Cam catches Itsi, Bitsi, & Mini doing their thing!

item.title: Bob's back, Baby... and ballistic over the iPhone, MySpace and the U.S. Open
item.description:
Bob's back and loving this week's guest - theguyfromboston.net -- Joe Ligotti. Don't miss Joe's no holds barred rants on 21st century parents, gas prices, and the "Octo-mom". Meanwhile, Bob has a few choice words of his own for the U.S. Open which refused to run a Go Daddy ad during its telecast. Also on tap: Nik The Geek weighs in on the new iPhone 3GS and Owen Thomas reports on Steve Jobs' health. And on the Internet Files, the Chinese government learns not to get between the people and their porn. Plus, does Bing have Google right where it wants them? Plus: Ham Cam catches Itsi, Bitsi, & Mini....napping?
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved. No hamsters were harmed here, we promise!

item.title: A Special Re-Broadcast of The "Ragin' Cajun" Superstar of Political Spin
item.description: In a very special, and Twitter-heavy, edition of the show, superstar political advisor James Carville weighs in on Somali pirates, Congress & Pres. Obama's performance, while Valleywag's Owen Thomas reports on the SF Mayor's ambitious quest, which was announced via -- you guessed it -- Twitter! And in the Internet Files, the experts have some tough words for the Domino's workers whose prank created a PR nightmare for the pizza chain & agree that Oprah -- who just joined the Twitter craze -- soon will surpass the million-"Follower" barrier, which Ashton Kutcher, of all people, just broke. Plus: Bob has his eyes set on a very special new Go Daddy Girl -- but will Hillary Clinton accept his intriguing $1 million proposition?

item.title: Celebrating Life's Misery & Microsoft Reinvents Search -- Again
item.description: Celebrating Life's Misery & Microsoft Reinvents Search -- Again Life can be a bitch, but FMyLife.com helps you find some humor in the misery. Alan Holding & Frans van Schoor join us to discuss their site & explain why people love to share their crappy life experiences with the world. Also on the menu: Nik the Geek expresses his love for the new Google Android phone and Owen Thomas reports on Yahoo CEO Carol Bartz' penchant for foul language. And in the Internet Files, our tech experts agree that Microsoft's revamped "Bing" search engine looks promising. But will people really make the switch? And as a man's Twitter post about leaving town might have triggered a break-in at his house, Brad admits, that he, too, has Twittered his whereabouts. Plus: More in-studio footage from the HamCam!

item.title: Cuban Cigars, Danica Makes History & Who Should Control the Internet?
item.description:
With her new commercial and historic Indy 500 3rd-place finish, Go Daddy Girl Danica Patrick once again stole the headlines, and she joins us to relive the dramatic race and that steamy ad! Also on the guest list: Former NTIA Chief John Kneuer weighs in on the EU's "misguided" call for globalizing ICANN and wonders what would happen if the UN took over. And in the Internet Files, the panelists reveal how a 3-year-old girl won an Internet auction for a $12,000 earth moving behemoth while mom was napping. And will intrepid Cuban bloggers succeed in undermining the Castro regime so Bob can finally smoke a good cigar? Plus: Nik the Geek & more unedited footage from the HamCam!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved. No hamsters were harmed here, we promise!

item.title: The Virginity Auction & America's Obsession With Female Purity!
item.description:
It's the show that never shies away from controversy! Author & outspoken feminist Jessica Valenti eviscerates abstinence-only education and society's obsession with chastity, which, she says, is hurting young women. Also on the menu: 22-year-old Natalie Dylan explains what compelled her to sell her virginity to the highest bidder and why the much-publicized Internet auction is a cold, hard business. And in the Internet Files, the pundits examine Dell's grossly miscalculated "Della" initiative, and Bob & Nima consider Twitter's porn star name game and reveal what their screen names could have been! Plus: More, unedited in-studio footage from the HamCam!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.
No hamsters were harmed here, we promise!

item.title: Hanging With the Diggnation Dudes & a Hamster's Eye View of Radio Go Daddy!
item.description:
In a show that offers a live & unedited behind-the-scenes look at Radio Go Daddy, we check in with Diggnation's Alex Albrecht and Kevin Rose who reminisce about beer and that memorable show when Candice stripped in front of a raucous live audience. Also on tap: Valleywag's Owen Thomas brutally dismisses Tesla CEO Elon Musk's dream of a manned mission to Mars! And in the Internet Files, the panelists ponder some disturbing news from the FAA and wonder which Federal computer system will be hacked next. And how did sensitive information about the THAAD missile defense system appear on a discarded computer that was sold online?
Plus: We unveil the HamCam! As our in-studio hamsters spin in their wheel, you'll see what the rodents see!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.
No hamsters were harmed here, we promise!

item.title: Pole Dancing, Supercomputers & and Internet Super-Celeb!
item.description:
It's the show that boldly declares the death of Twitter, yet gets you the scoop on a possible blockbuster merger involving the micro-blogging phenomenon! Our guest, NonSociety blogger & Web celeb Julia Allison, tells us the secrets to her Internet fame, while Bree Baker -- that sexy cop from the new Go Daddy ad -- reveals how pole dancing lessons helped her prepare for the steamy gig.  And in the Internet Files, the panelists agree that supercomputers capable of outsmarting humans will emerge in a not-too-distant future. Plus: Our experts aren't convinced that the newest "Google Killer" will revolutionize the world of search. But Brad & Warren at least dig its very geeky name!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Swine Flu Updates on Twitter & Barbara Lippert Rips our New Commercial!
item.description:
Bob's in Hawaii, Nima's in NYC, and our favorite ad critic, AdWeek's Barbara Lippert, rips our new Danica Patrick commercial. It is, she says, degrading and just "embarassing!" In the Internet Files, the panel ponders the future of MySpace and lauds the CDC's Swine Flu updates on Twitter. And did IBM blow it by allowing Oracle to step in and snatch Sun Microsystems? Plus: Valleywag's Owen Thomas has the scoop on Libertarian Facebook investor Peter Thiel, who declared women's suffrage a mistake!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: The "Ragin' Cajun" Superstar of Political Spin & an Intriguing Proposition for Hillary Clinton!
item.description: In a very special, and Twitter-heavy, edition of the show, superstar political advisor James Carville weighs in on Somali pirates, Congress & Pres. Obama's performance, while Valleywag's Owen Thomas reports on the SF Mayor's ambitious quest, which was announced via -- you guessed it -- Twitter! And in the Internet Files, the experts have some tough words for the Domino's workers whose prank created a PR nightmare for the pizza chain & agree that Oprah -- who just joined the Twitter craze -- soon will surpass the million-"Follower" barrier, which Ashton Kutcher, of all people, just broke. Plus: Bob has his eyes set on a very special new Go Daddy Girl -- but will Hillary Clinton accept his intriguing $1 million proposition?

item.title: Cyber Spies, Al Sharpton & Sheriff Joe's Very Own Reality TV Show!
item.description:
America's Toughest Sheriff -- Joe Arpaio -- has got his own reality TV show, and he's with us LIVE in-studio to tell us how it helped reel in over 400 offenders with outstanding warrants, and why neither the Justice Dept., nor the Rev. Al Sharpton has him quaking in his boots. Also on the menu: Nik the Geek checks out the new iPod Shuffle. And in the Internet Files, the panelists are underwhelmed by Facebook's new monetization feature, but intrigued by British police's new method of clamping down on distracted drivers. Plus, Bob has his very own reasons for being unconcerned with Chinese cyberwarfare! Plus: More $$$ for the people in chat!!!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: The Scandalous Mark Nemcoff & a Street View Witch Hunt!
item.description:
The Pacific Coast Hellway show is on hiatus, but it's creator -- Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff -- entertains us with observations on OctoMom, Chris Brown and other tales from his scandalous new show "Things I Learned This Week." Meanwhile, Valleywag's Owen Thomas serves up some juicy stuff on Tesla Motors CEO Elon Musk's disintegrating marriage. In the Internet Files, the pundits discuss whether it's OK for Britain's "Sexiest Teacher" to show off lingerie on the Web and agree that Rupert Murdoch should worry about fixing MySpace instead of attacking Google and Yahoo. Also on the menu: In a story straight out of the Dark Ages, hordes of English villagers drive a Google® Street View car out of town. Plus: Nik the Geek returns to tell us about cell phone software that helps circumvent red light cameras and speed traps.
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Lethal SMS, Victorian Ghosts & Radio Go Daddy Turns 4!
item.description:
It's April 1st, Radio Go Daddy is turning 4, and Valleywag's Owen Thomas briefs us on Silicon Valley's April Fool's Day pranks, while our resident techie -- "Nik the Geek" -- joins the cast. Our guest is Tumblr founder David Karp, who gets us the lowdown on his mixed-media microblogging platform & how it differs from Twitter. And in the Internet Files, the panelists discuss a horrifying "Killer SMS" & agree that the media-savvy Mark Cuban deliberately Twittered himself into trouble with the NBA. Also on the menu: Did Google's Street View really capture a Victorian ghost in Wales? Plus: A very special anniversary greeting from the irresistible Obama Girl!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: New Go Daddy Girl Burns Up the Golf Course!
item.description:
In a show that includes gossip, hot women & crazy programmers, Valleywag's Owen Thomas reveals the real reason Jennifer Aniston dumped John Mayer, and our sizzling new Go Daddy Girl' -- Aussie LPGA ace Anna Rawson -- joins us to chat about her runway and fairway careers & the new putter she procured for Bob. And in the Internet Files, Warren is enticed by Cadillac's latest offering, while the panelists wonder what made a deranged Finnish programmer replace his injured finger with a USB drive. Also on the menu: A California high school enrolls the Internet in its battle against plagiarism. And the pundits think it just might work!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Drunken Geeks, Responsible Twittering & the President's Bailout Eviscerated!
item.description:
In a show that features drunken geeks, girl scouts & the Holy Pontiff -- Valleywag's Owen Thomas talks about the ultimate "Spring Break for Geeks" while world-class spinmeister Dick Morris weighs in on the Pope, condoms & Pres. Obama's stimulus & bailout plans, which, he says, are just "wrong, wrong, wrong!" And in the Internet Files, the panelists discuss the concept of "Tweeting Responsibly" & try to understand how an entrepreneurial Girl Scout got herself in hot water for peddling cookies on the Web. And as the Linden $$$ are starting to dry up in Second Life, Bob & Co. wonder if the financial crisis is slowing things down in the virtual Red Light District, too.
Plus: Susan Fitter tells us how to reply to email while Bob provides his own piece of irreverent etiquette advice to men!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Game Theory, Netiquette & a Very Bright New Go Daddy Girl!
item.description:
In a show that that introduces two new segments, etiquette expert Susan Fitter offers a sobering lesson on social networking, while ValleyWag's Owen Thomas briefs us on the SF mayor's kooky cousin Chloe! Our guest is new Go Daddy Girl' Vanessa Rousso, Team PokerStars Pro -- who tells us about the intellectual approach that propelled her to the top and why poker players wear their sunglasses at night. And in the Internet Files, the panelists discuss whether Twitter should be allowed in Federal courtrooms & wonder what the Second Life crowd might do with virtual reality for all five senses. Plus, Bob believes Craigslist's Erotic Services section can actually help authorities crack down on prostitution!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Radio Go Daddy Hits Vegas!
item.description:
In a very special -- and rather rowdy -- edition of the show, we're coming to you from Bob's Caesar's Palace suite in Sin City where Bob talks about his new favorite car & pro poker player Mike "The Mouth" Matusow fills us in on his trash talking table manners, which earned him that very appropriate nickname. And in the Internet Files, the panelists digest the fact that Romania has a semi-official UFO Network & reveal Melinda Gates' hidden, forbidden passion for the iPhone. Also on the menu: In a story worthy of Jackass, we tell you about allegations involving a cell phone, a patient's delicate predicament, an X-ray & Facebook that landed two nurses in hot water!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Diamond Rings, Regifting & Other Tales of Silicon Valley Celebs Behaving Badly!
item.description:
In a show that takes on global warming, Chevy Impalas, DABA Girls & the concept of an "Anarcho-Transexual Afro-Chicano," Silicon Valley's top gossip columnist -- Valleywag's Owen Thomas -- entertains us with an exclusive scoop on the Google CEO's regifting habits & other juicy tales of Bay Area celebs behaving badly. And in the Internet Files, the panel discusses the implications of bringing the Deep Web to the masses & marvels at Craigslist's ability to procure just about anything -- including human organs. Also on the menu: Should doctors really be Twittering while performing major surgery? Warren offers a conditional "yes."
Plus, we're handing out more $$$ to the listeners in chat!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: LIVE From Scottsdale -- It's Candice & the Super Bowl's Most Unexpected Star!
item.description:
In a show that features air travelers, card counters & edgy women -- the Super Bowl's most unexpected star -- adult actress Tristan Kingsley -- joins us LIVE in-studio to talk about the "incident" & get Bob's view on how Comcast can make amends for its mistake. Also with us in-studio: Our very own Candice Michelle shows off the new move that'll help her reclaim her WWE throne. And in the Internet Files, the panelists entertain themselves with a Hong Kong woman's epic airport tantrum & wonder if you can get away with using your iPhone to count cards at Nevada casinos. Plus: Bob thinks its time for anonymous flamers to start owning up to their nasty comments!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: A Devout Christian Decries our Super Bowl Ads!
item.description:
Web 2.0 has shaped the Internet. But how has this phenom affected our culture & values? My guest is Andrew Keen -- a self-proclaimed "elitist" whose "The Cult of the Amateur" decried Web 2.0's worship of amateurism & made him the blogosphere's Public Enemy No. 1!
Also on our guest list: Web entrepreneur Brian Harrell who removed his clients' Web sites from Go Daddy due to our "non-Christian" & "exploitative" Super Bowl ads.
On the Internet Files, my resident panel of experts & I discuss this week's hottest tech stories: • Know where your kids are? A new Google tool helps you track them down! • "25 Things About Me" -- the latest Facebook fad takes Web 2.0 navel-gazing to another level! • Google glitch temporarily flags the entire Internet as malware! Plus, we'll have a special segment: "What Would Bob Do?"

item.title: Another Super Bowl Home Run & Zombies in Austin
item.description:
In a show that spans the Pacific Ocean & revisits the media's post-Super Bowl roasting of Go Daddy, the ad industry's "flaming pen" -- AdWeek's Barbara Lippert -- tries to understand how "Baseball," which she hates, became the game's most-watched commercial. And in the Internet Files, we relay a chilling story about zombies in Texas & reveal how Google Earth helped Swiss police catch a ring of clueless hemp growers. Also on the menu: The panelists wonder if Venice tourists will pre-pay for public toilets or simply relieve themselves in the canals. Plus, we're once again handing out $$$ to our listeners in chat!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Pre-Game Buzz & a Real Stinker for the iPhone
item.description:
As we count down to the Super Bowl & sift through the pre-game media buzz, AdRants' Steve Hall hands down his unforgiving verdict on our Super Bowl ads, while Joel Comm, the brains behind iFart, tells us how he came up with this outlandish & unexplainably successful iPhone application. And in the Internet Files, the panel wonders if -- as Bob hopes -- a disastrous sales report will finally spell the end for the Zune & ponders the fate of a new Web hangout for the rich & famous. And what would a native New Yorker like Nima do if police told her to hand over her iPod as payment for a cab ride?
Plus: We give away hundreds of $$$ to the lucky people in chat!!!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved

item.title: Spring Break Gone Wild & A New Low for iPhone Applications
item.description:
In a show that goes where no radio show has gone before, Bob demos his cringe worthy new iPhone application & updates us on the too-close-to-call Super Bowl ad vote. And in the Internet Files, we discuss who's to blame for a 17-year-old's smutty Spring Break activities & wonder who would actually befriend a police department on Facebook. Also on the menu, we check out the next-generation parking meters which render meter maids obsolete. Plus a former director of Faith-Based Services finds himself in hot water after launching a prostitute-rating Web site & peddling raffle tickets for a night with a hooker.
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved

item.title: "Stupid. Just Awful!!!" -- How Barbara Lippert Really Feels About Our Super Bowl Ads
item.description:
It's almost Super Bowl time, and our favorite ad critic -- AdWeek's Barbara Lippert -- checks in to pass the verdict on our two spots. And while she kinda likes "Shower," she pulls no punches in eviscerating the "stupid," "awful" & "not even funny" "Baseball" ad. And in the Internet Files, we discuss the carbon footprints of Google searches and Second Life avatars and wonder what virtual stand-ins for active-duty parents will do for -- or to -- the kids. Also on the menu: A virtual escort provides an inside look at Second Life's Red Light District.
Plus: We're asking YOU to help us pick which ad to air during the Big Game!
Third-party products and brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: A New Platform for Public Self-Pitying & Another Mishap Hits the Zune
item.description:
In the first show of the new year, we examine the Twitter phenomenon & get you the lowdown on Go Daddy's Super Bowl commercial and the inevitable controversy it attracts. And in the Internet Files, we check out the newest Web pulpit for bitching, self-pitying & schadenfreude while the panelists wonder if Chinese porn producers could circumvent the Govt's Internet censors by sticking to old-fashioned hard-copy material. Also on the menu, the team gets a kick out of the latest misfortune to hit Bob's favorite media player as thousands of Zunes simultaneously freeze on New Year's Eve.
Super Bowl, Twitter & Zune are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved

item.title: Ninja Advice, Pink Underwear & the Go Daddy Year in Review
item.description:
In the New Year's Eve edition of the show we revisit the top Go Daddy moments of the past year, including Danica making history, a Royal visit to Scottsdale, Go Daddy-driven legislation and, of course, Super Bowl ads and a bit of controversy. Also on the menu: Our favorite guest segments of 2008, including: Sheriff Arpaio's preference for pink underwear, Barbara Lippert's blistering critique, Obama Girl's crush on Go Daddy & some very salient advice from the Web's most famous ninja!
Super Bowl is a registered trademark of the National Football League. All rights reserved.

item.title: Tumbleweeds, Stupid Gifts & the Very Wackiest Internet Files of the Year!
item.description:
In a special Holiday edition of the show, we look back at our favorite Internet Files moments of 2008 & check out the "Potty Putter" and other of the year's dumbest gift ideas as listed by Stupid.com. Our guest is Prairie Tumbleweed Farm founder Linda Katz who runs one of the wackiest Web businesses we've ever come across. She makes a -- very decent -- living selling real tumbling tumbleweeds from her home on the Kansas prairie! And in the Internet Files, we relive the Top 10 stories of the year, including the unforgettable tales of how an enraged woman exacted revenge on her virtual ex-hubby and the Second Life affair that led to a real-world divorce. Plus, of course, the strange story of the German woman who peddled her services online, slept with 6 men & filed a paternity suit when she realized she was pregnant.
Second Life is a registered trademark of Linden Research, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Virtual Weddings, Flawed Internet Filters & a Candid Discussion About Go Daddy Business Practices
item.description: In a highly spirited edition of the show, Bob & ardent Go Daddy critic Andrew Allemann of Domain Name Wire cross swords for a candid discussion about domain auctions, transfers and other parts of Go Daddy's business that have ired the industry watchdog. And in the Internet Files, the panel digests the news that almost half of all women prefer the Internet to sex and wonders why the Australian Govt. is moving forward with its Internet filter, which, the panel declares, will not work. Plus, our pundits try to understand why the Second Life bridal industry is doing so well. And how much does a virtual wedding cost anyway?

item.title: Rome Burns, Cyprus Dances, Venice Drowns & Go Daddy Parties Like It's 1999!
item.description:
In a highly party-centric edition of the show, Bob & Nima discuss the somewhat critical media coverage of Go Daddy's Holiday Bash & ponder the question: Is it OK to throw a party for the ages while the economy is tanking? Meanwhile, Blip.Tv founder & CEO Mike Hudack - who has also received his fare share of party-related press lately -- joins us to talk about that much-maligned "Camp Cyprus" video, which placed him at the center of a blogosphere firestorm. And in the Internet Files, we discuss one teenager's incredibly ill-advised text message to her dad & wonder if the drowning city of Venice will be entirely submerged before it can implement free Internet for all of its citizens. Plus: Bob hands us the scoop on the two new Go Daddy Super Bowl commercials!
Blip.Tv is a registered trademark of Blip Networks, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Live From Los Angeles: It's Radio Go Daddy!
item.description: In a very special edition of the show, broadcast from Los Angeles where we're shooting our new Danica Patrick Super Bowl commercials, Danica joins us to chat about making the ads, her 3-hour shower & the upcoming IndyCar season. And in the Internet Files, Bob & his team wonder if the long winter nights are the reason Canadians spend more time on social networking than Americans & discuss what, if anything, can be done to diminish how cell phone conversations distract drivers. Plus, if Internet searches, as a new study suggests, boosts the brain activity of older people, does it matter what they're searching for?

item.title: A Very Ninja Thanksgiving
item.description: We celebrate Thanksgiving by replaying one of the year's very best shows. So once again, sit back & enjoy as Bob & Nima cross swords with Ask a Ninja creator Kent Nichols who debunks a few myths & takes us inside the mind of the Internet's premier martial artist. And in the Internet Files, we show you the dangers of adding your boss to your Facebook friends list, tell you how an enraged woman exacted revenge on her virtual hubby & ponder the Google execs' decision to add a fighter jet to their already-impressive air fleet.

item.title: Marshmallow Shooters, Virtual Girlfriends & Big Trouble at Yahoo
item.description: In a show that touches on Nigerian scammers, virtual girlfriends & sex in cyberspace, Boing Boing founder Mark Frauenfelder tells us how to get in touch with our inner geek and build robots, spy cameras & marshmallow shooters from common household items. And in the Internet Files, we check out another weird -- and slightly disturbing -- Japanese toy and list the 5 worst mistakes made by the Yahoo top. Also on the menu: The panel wonders whether having cyber sex with an animated prostitute constitutes real-life cheating. Plus: Bob reveals that Go Daddy will be back for yet another "GoDaddy-esque" Super Bowl commercial come February.

item.title: The Truth Is Out There...
item.description:
In a show worthy of the X-Files, Black Vault founder John Greenewald, Jr. shares his vast knowledge of UFOs, government cover-ups & the fabled "Area 51" and tells us why -- after 12 years of collecting & studying govt. documents--he's certain that aliens exist. And in the Internet Files, we discuss the British government's draconian new Internet monitoring initiative & tell you what made an Italian judge charge Google executives with defamation. Also on the menu: A new study concludes that violent Web content is more damaging to youths than TV, movies & games.
Plus: Bob calls the bluff on the Rev. John Aboh whose unsolicited e-mail message promises a cool $9.5 million courtesy of the Nigerian Government.

item.title: Pesky Rodents, Rude Flight Crews & How to Protect Your Online Identity
item.description:
In a show that covers cyber bullies, Big Apple rats and a new President, our guest, ReputationDefender founder Michael Fertik, explains how you can take control of your online identity before crooks, identity thieves & your own past do it for you. And in the Internet Files, Virgin Atlantic flight crew turn to Facebook to ridicule passengers, while New York City enlists a new weapon in its battle against pesky rodents. And the daughter of the former Yahoo CEO endorses Google ... sort of.
Plus: With the election in the books, Bob wonders if the President-elect can fix Vista!

item.title: I'm Ninja, He's Ninja, She's Ninja, Too!
item.description: It's the show that takes you inside the mind of the Web's top martial arts maven! Bob & Nima cross swords with Ask a Ninja creator Kent Nichols who explains the Ninja Path & sets the record straight on some of the many ninja misconceptions that permeate modern culture. And in the Internet Files, we show you the dangers of adding your boss to your Facebook friends list & wonder why Google's Brin & Page just got themselves a fighter jet. Plus, we learn how an enraged woman exacted revenge on her virtual ex-hubby.

item.title: Political Punditry & Tales From the Clinton White House
item.description: It's a show that covers everything from STD notices via e-greeting to tales from the Clinton inner circle. Pollster, pundit & political strategist Dick Morris joins us LIVE in studio to dissect the presidential race & tell us what went down behind the scenes in the Clinton White House. And in the Internet Files, PBS & YouTube conceive a new way to spice up the vote, while an innovative Web service lets you send anonymous e-greetings to sex partners you might have exposed to an STD.

item.title: Go Daddy Goes Social & Google Saves You From Yourself
item.description:
As we turn the page on a week that saw Go Daddy enter the social networking ring with the release of SmartSpace & a vicious new hacking form targeting users across the Web, our pundits once again tackle the latest & hottest tech topics. In the Internet Files, we discuss Google's Mail Goggles," which could save you the embarrassment of e-mailing while under the influence & check out the new technology that keeps teenagers from yapping on cell phones while driving.
Plus: The Government strikes a blow against Internet predators as the Go Daddy-supported "Protect Our Children Internet Act of 2008" becomes law.

item.title: Obama Girl, Cloud Computing & Spies on Facebook!
item.description: The election is near & Obama Girl -- aka Amber Lee Ettinger-- makes a triumphant return to the show. We check out her latest videos, listen to her new single & take the temperature on her crush on Obama. And in the Internet Files, we zoom in on Microsoft's planned cloud computing edition of Windows & wonder why Britain's MI6 would recruit spies on Facebook. Also on the menu: A bank robber hires decoys on Craigslist & pulls off one audacious heist...

item.title: McCain Girl Rocks the Vote!
item.description: As the Presidential election campaign enters the home stretch, the "Incredible McCain Girl" aka Kate Secor, pays us a visit to chat about her hit YouTube videos & reveal her true allegiances. And in the Internet Files, we ponder a new study which confirms that Facebook is a haven for narcissists & check out the latest phenomenon to hit Japanese cyberspace: Animated virtual boyfriends. Plus, the "Father of the Internet" -- Vint Cerf -- warns that the Internet is running out of IP addresses.

item.title: Google Sets Sail & Do Androids Dream of World Domination?
item.description: Straight from the depths of Africa, Bob returns with a vengeance to spew venom at Windows Vista & those at fault for the nation's economic quagmire. Atty. Jones calls in from Washington to brief us on some crucial legislation Go Daddy helped craft & which is on the verge of being signed into law. And in the Internet Files, Bob & his team check out the first Google Android phone & discuss whether or not the device will rule the mobile world. Also on the menu, we digest Google's outlandish concept of building & deploying data centers on ships.

item.title: Fashion, Fed-Up Flight Attendants & German Alarmists -- Radio Go Daddy Has it All!
item.description: In a show that features everything from unhappy flight attendants to GD Girls on Fashion Week runways, we entertain you with the Best of the Blog & repeat our clues to Bob's mystery location. And in the Internet Files, two new pundits join the line-up to weigh in on the German Govt's dubious decision to warn against Google Chrome & how Facebook content might impact your job hunting success. Plus: Should airlines filter in-flight Internet? Fed-up flight attendants think so while our experts hand in a split decision

item.title: Will Google Chrome Rule the Web?
item.description:
In Bob's continued absence, Nima & the crew bring you up to speed on the latest news, including Go Daddy's first venture into NASCAR's Sprint Cup Series. And in the Internet Files, we take a closer look at Google's new Chrome browser & whether or not the new competition will have Microsoft quaking in its boots. We also give you the low-down on JetBlue's innovative sales tactics & a US Appeals Court's ruling on the usage of Wikipedia information in US Courts.
Plus: Another clue to Bob's mystery location!
JetBlue, Google, NASCAR & Wikipedia are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Would Google Dare to Ditch The Free Dinners?
item.description: With Nima filling in for the Boss, who's in an undisclosed location, we bring back the always-intriguing Where in the World Is Bob? contest & read you the very Best of the Blog. And in the Internet Files, the tech pundits discuss whether Google would dare to ditch its free dinners & what would happen if Go Daddy introduced Google-like afternoon "Tea Trolley" services for the staff. Also on the menu: Can Warren resist the temptation of in-flight Internet & will "Porn Mode" make IE8 an instant hit with Web surfers?

item.title: Cell phone service so bad, it's a crime?!
item.description:
On this episode of Radio GoDaddy, Bob Parsons and the gang discussed their own experiences with the Apple iPhone 3G! Discover the phone that Bob is dying to get his hands on. Speaking of iPhone, the one and only 'Attorney Jones' was in the studio sharing her expert legal opinion on the iPhone 3G lawsuit! An Alabama woman's iPhone 3G wouldn't work now she's trying to start a class action lawsuit against Apple! Does she have a chance? Plus, the Radio GoDaddy team touches on the top 10 web glitches of 2008 and shares their thoughts on what will be the next big issues for the rest of the year. Bob's own Apple iPhone 3G experience!
Apple & iPhone are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved

item.title: The Return of Radio Go Daddy!
item.description: We're Back! Episode #156! Bob Parsons and the rest of the RadioGoDaddy crew talk about what's been happening with Go Daddy over the past few weeks! Also, Bob has a fascinating chat with Dan Kaminsky, security researcher, who is credited with discovering the DNS flaw. Find out if there's a book in the works about his experiences and why Dan's girlfriend has told him, "Don't break the internet again!"

item.title: The Curtain Drops on Go Daddy LIVE!
item.description:
In the final installment of the show in its current incarnation, Bob & Co. reminisce about the highs & lows of Radio Go Daddy/Life Online/Go Daddy LIVE's 3-year run & get a dose of gossip from Celebridiot.com founder John Pomponio who entertains the crew with his take on Paris Hilton, Britney & the best & latest scandals involving American Idol hosts & contestants. Plus, Pomponio tells us exactly what a "Celebridiot" is, while decrying the recent lack of really juicy celebrity train wrecks.
In the Internet Files, the team tackles the week's top stories, including Americans' increasing dependency on their cell phones, Ask.com's latest attempt to find itself a market nice & the somewhat odd theory that proliferating iPods have caused an increase in violent crime.
PLUS: We bring you the funniest & most defining moment of the show's history!

item.title: Obama Girl's Got a Crush on Go Daddy!
item.description: As the Presidential campaign heats up, one candidate's most enthusiastic supporter pays us a visit. Amber Lee Ettinger aka "Obama Girl" checks in to chat about her steamy campaign contributions, her favorite candidate & to admit that she's got a crush on Go Daddy, too. And in the Internet Files, the team discusses how Wikipedia founder Jimmy Wales used his online encyclopedia to break up with a girlfriend & what not-so-celibate Thai monks are doing in cyberspace. Plus, Bob hits the street to talk to people about the Internet!

item.title: Know Those Neighbors From Hell ... Before You Move!
item.description:
In a show that takes a close look at busybodies, habitual complainers, howling dogs, Meth labs & other neighbors from Hell, RottenNeighbor.com founder Brant Walker gives us the lowdown on his Web site, which delivers the naked truth on your future neighborhood before you sign the paperwork on your dream home. And in the Internet Files, we discuss how Network Solutions' persistent domain name frontrunning finally led to a lawsuit & how 2 young Belgrade looters became instant celebs on YouTube.
Network Solutions & YouTube are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Hanging With America's Toughest Sheriff!
item.description:
In a show that explores chain gangs, pink underwear & Elvis, "America's Toughest Sheriff" -- Joe Arpaio - joins us in-studio to chat about the job & his re-election campaign. Plus, Sheriff Joe fills us in his "Dead Beat Parents" program, the always-lit "Vacancy" sign at his Tent City & the night he locked up The King. And in the Internet Files, we dissect Microsoft's decision to turn hostile in its Yahoo takeover bid & the strange tale of a German woman who peddled her services online, slept with 6 men & filed a paternity suit when she realized she was pregnant.
Microsoft & Yahoo! are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Relive Our Highest-Rated Show of All Time!
item.description: As Go Daddy LIVE! approaches its 3rd anniversary, we thought it was time to replay the highest rated show of all time! Leland Hardy, Sports agent extraordinaire & founder of NewYork.com. Find out how this one-man show built a top Web portal, was Muhammad Ali's Chinese interpreter and spotted Serena & Venus Williams! With Super Bowl XLII now history, we'll replay Chad "Ocho Cinco" Johnson's mid-season assessment of the Patriots. Was Chad right? The Internet Files -- you just never get tired of hearing great tech topics discussed by Bob, Warren, Brad (and Nima, too!).

item.title: No Longer "Lowest of the Low": Handing Down the Verdict on our Super Bowl Ad!
item.description:
As the dust settles on the Super Bowl extravaganza, we recap the post-game media blitz & chat with sharp-penned ad critic Barbara Lippert who hands down her verdict on our Big Game commercial. Much to Bob's chagrin, Lippert declares that the ad certainly was "stupid" but entirely too effective to claim the title of "lowest of the low." And in the Internet Files, we discuss Microsoft's audacious bid for Yahoo! & whether Yahoo! should fend it off or embrace the enemy.
Plus, we bring you some of the very best & most colorful post-game comments from the blog!
Microsoft, Super Bowl & Yahoo! are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: Pre-Super Bowl Buzz & Broken Clavicles with Candice in Studio
item.description:
In a show that covers the latest buzz on our Super Bowl ads & the pre-game media blitz, Original Go Daddy Girl Candice Michelle joins us LIVE in studio to tell us what it feels like to crack a clavicle & when she'll be back in the ring to exact some much-needed revenge on her nemesis, Beth Phoenix. Plus, Bob boldly predicts the Giants to pull off a major upset on Sunday. And in the Internet Files, we check out the possibility of nuke-sniffing cell phones & discuss Google's efforts to end domain tasting.
Bonus Video: The 3 Go Daddy Girls entertaining visitors at Go Daddy's CES booth!

item.title: Life in the Fast Lane & Final Approval of Our Big Game Ad!
item.description: In a show that picks Nima's new theme song & celebrates life in the fast lane, LifeOnTop.com co-founders Terry Knealing & David Schoenecker join us in studio to talk about Lamborghinis, yachts, 10-person Ferrari limos & other toys that make the filthy-rich salivate. On the Super Bowl front, Bob announces that on the heels of the "Beaver" incident, Go Daddy finally got an ad past Fox's censors. And in the Internet Files, the panel takes the pulse on Microsoft's creepy big brother monitoring system & ponders the implications of 40-hour laptop batteries.

item.title: Revving it up With Danica & One Controversial Rodent
item.description: We warm up the engines for the Super Bowl & 2008 IndyCar circuit as our raciest Go Daddy Girl, Danica Patrick, joins us live in studio to chat about her career, her goals & Go Daddy's "Exposure" Super Bowl ad, which stars Danica & a certain dam-building rodent, but was nixed by Fox because Bob insisted on calling a beaver -- a beaver. We also get Bob's take on super models & Victoria's Secret's lingerie line. And in the Internet Files, we discuss the violent death of a Chinese blogger, Britain's new mammoth supercomputer & the Web site that threatens to bring the Sicilian Mafia to its knees.

item.title: The Greatest Swimmer of All Time & The Passing of a Once Mighty Browser
item.description: In a show that revisits some of the most memorable moments in Olympic history, the legendary Mark Spitz drops in to chat about his phenomenal career, next summer's Beijing Games & the story behind that very un-Olympic moustache of his. We also get Mark's take on the infamous Munich Massacre, which he witnessed first-hand. And in the Internet Files we discuss the sad but inevitable passing of the Netscape browser & predict a possible winner in the ongoing HD DVD format battle. Plus, we review how Network Solutions got caught red-handed engaging in domain name "front-running."

item.title: The Very Best of Go Daddy LIVE 2007
item.description: We ring in the new year with a very special "Best of the Year" edition of Go Daddy LIVE! Join us as we relive our favorite guests of the year, including political spin & witch doctor FRANK LUNTZ, XXXChurch creator CRAIG GROSS, the remarkable LELAND HARDY, plus, of course, the audacious Material Bitch founder BETHANY MCNELLY. Also on the menu, BARBARA LIPPERT's post-game broadside against Go Daddy's Super Bowl XLI commercial.

item.title: Connecting People in Need With the Everyday Heroes Willing to Help Them!
item.description:
In the last show of 2007, we commemorate the season with a very special edition of Go Daddy LIVE!
Our guest is Wish Upon a Hero founder Dave Girgenti whose remarkable Web project connects people in need with the everyday heroes willing to help them. Since his site's Sept. launch, more than 2,500 people have had perfect strangers grant their deepest wishes.
Plus, we bring you Bob's Top 10 Keys to Success in 2008!

item.title: Busting Vegas, U R Dumped & Have Wired's Editors Gone Mad?
item.description: He chronicles audacious whiz kids milking Vegas casinos & working the financial markets. Ben Mezrich, NY Times bestselling author of "Bringing Down the House," "Busting Vegas" & "Rigged" joins us to chat about sophisticated card counting schemes, life in the fast lane & how the part trade floor, part casino & part madhouse that is the New York Mercantile Exchange influences world economy & the price at the pump. In the Internet Files, we discuss the ethical aspect of dumping someone via txt msg & ponder the question: Have Wired's editors lost their minds?

item.title: A Peek Into the Deep End of the Human Soul
item.description: In a show that ventures into the darkest pits of the human soul, PostSecret founder Frank Warren joins us to talk about his bustling art community, his gut-wrenching new book & some of the quirky & harrowing confessions he has received. In the Go Daddy LIVE Football Report, Chad reveals who should play the leading role when the inevitable Ocho Cinco biopic sees the light of day. And in the Internet Files, we check out JetBlue's Wi-Fi in the sky & the strange, electronic tombstone called the "Serenity Panel."

item.title: Striking Screenwriters, Inflatable Mooseheads & The Top Searches of 2007
item.description:
As the screenwriters' strike enters its fifth week, "Daily Show" scribe Jason Ross joins us to talk about the strike, its reasons, its possible outcome, the specter of more reality TV & the hilarious, studio-exec-lampooning video he & his fellow Daily Show writers posted on YouTube. In the Internet Files, we check out the year's top Internet searches & take a look at this holiday season's most idiotic gift ideas.
The Daily Show & YouTube are registered trademarks of their respective owners. All rights reserved.

item.title: The Pacific Coast Hellway, The King Is Alive & The Black Friday Zune Frenzy
item.description: In the return of one our most entertaining guests, Pacific Coast Hellway founder Mark Yoshimoto Nemcoff drops in to charm Nima & chat about his crude, lewd & occasionally-offensive podcast. In the Go Daddy LIVE Football Report, Chad & Bob discuss boorish Jets fans, death threats against Leona Helmsley's canine heir & the fate of the Elvis Is Alive Museum. And in the Internet Files, the panel looks at the Black Friday rush to snag discounted Zunes & CNET's naming Windows Vista one of the year's "Top 10 Terrible Tech Products."

item.title: A Walk Down Memory Lane with Toby the Rabbit & the Original Radio Go Daddy Crew
item.description: Relive the very first Radio Go Daddy broadcast from March 2005 as we kick off the holiday season with a special pre-Turkey Day edition of Go Daddy LIVE. Our inaugural show featured Bob taking on the NTIA's decision to deny private registrations for .us domains & a special report on the controversial SaveToby.com Web site whose founder cynically threatened to slaughter & devour an innocent bunny rabbit unless someone coughed up a $50,000 ransom to save the cuddly critter.

item.title: Muhammad Ali's Chinese Interpreter, a Real-Life Fairy Tale & One Very Good Cause
item.description: The extraordinary Leland Hardy drops in to chat about his amazingly eventful life, which includes gigs as Muhammad Ali's Chinese interpreter, the Williams sisters' long-time agent and one thrilling heavyweight bout at Madison Sq. Garden. Plus, Bob donates $10,000 to Leland's latest project, Internet Equality, which aims to bring Internet knowledge & access to people around the world. In the Go Daddy LIVE Football Report, Chad ponders Don Shula's suggestion that New England's record this season should be accompanied by an asterisk. And the Internet Files serve up a real 21st century fairy tale as New Yorkers help a love struck young man find the woman of his dreams!

item.title: Google Enters the Wireless World & Should the US Govt. Control the Internet?
item.description: With Bob in an undisclosed location, Nima & Brad take the reins on this domain-industry themed show in which Atty Jones dissects ICANN chief Dr. Paul Twomey's renewed attempts to remove his organization from the US Govt.'s influence. Adam Dicker, owner of thriving online community DNForum.com, drops in for a chat about the domain industry & the present and future state of his DNForum. On the Go Daddy LIVE Football Report, a sore, swollen but good-spirited Chad Johnson discusses the scary neck injury he suffered on Sunday. And, the Internet Files zoom in on Google's long-awaited entry into the mobile phone world & Time Magazine's decision to name the iPhone "invention of the year."

item.title: The Pastor Who Offers Rehab for Adult Movie Stars
item.description:
In a Halloween edition of Go Daddy LIVE, Bob & Nima get in touch with their spiritual sides as pastor Craig Gross -- founder of XXXChurch.com -- guests the show to explain his virtual church's "porn rehab" services and why, as XXXChurch prints on its handout Bibles, "Jesus Loves Porn Stars." In our weekly football report, Bob boldly predicts that the Colts will down the Patriots while Chad reveals that he finds Queen Elizabeth sexy, but refuses to believe that Dallas QB Tony Romo has been spotted partying with Britney! In the Internet Files, Bob & his tech crew dissect the impending emergence of a Google-powered cell phone and discuss whether or not Google's dominance of the tech industry eventually will be total.
Bonus Video!: Behind-the-scenes footage from Amanda Beard's photo shoot, press conference and in-studio appearance!

item.title: One Go Daddy Girl takes a nasty fall & another one graces the pages of Playboy
item.description: Go Daddy Girl Daytona Beach, Lara Haworth describes how winning Employee of the Month won her a recent Playboy photo op --- much to the chagrin of Nima Jones, who only got a GoDaddy.com bumper sticker when she won a similar award. Bob examines the 'rough & tough' world of WWE and the nasty fall taken by Candice Michelle - how long until she returns to the ring? Then Chad Johnson tackles head-on the recent criticism he's received regarding his style of play and whether he is giving African-Americans a bad name in pro football. Finally, in the light-hearted Internet Files, Warren and "I don't have a job here Brad" debate whether free beer is an adequate reward for a lost laptop.

item.title: The Highs & Lows of Go Daddy Advertising - And Do iPhones Make You Sterile?
item.description: Sharp-tongued ad critic Barbara Lippert dukes it out with Bob over the highs & lows of Go Daddy advertising & explains why she thinks that Bob looks "tacky." In the Go Daddy LIVE Football Report, Chad & Bob discuss how the reeling Bengals can turn their season around. The Internet Files look at the "Dark Web" project that might help combat cyber-terrorism - and Greenpeace's claim that iPhones might make you sterile. Plus: We revisit Bob's appearance on the "Renegade Entrepreneurs" edition of CNBC's "Big Idea w/ Donny Deutsch."

item.title: Going deep with the marketing mastermind behind ESPN
item.description: We go behind the scenes with the ESPN President of Sales & Marketing, Ed Erhardt. Learn how the worldwide leader of sports feels about working with Go Daddy & find out which cool gifts are coming Bob's way -- and which ones he has already received. In the Go Daddy LIVE Pro Football Report, Chad & Bob discuss what goes on during a team's bye week and how a winning record can make a football player's life so much easier. And in what could be the craziest Internet Files story to date, North Korean leader Kim Jong Il almost makes the panel spontaneously combust or was that an iPod?

item.title: Jumping Into the Pool With our Hot New Go Daddy Girl
item.description: She is a a world-class athlete & successful model who has graced the cover of FHM® and Playboy®. Listen in as hot new Go Daddy Girl, elite swimmer Amanda Beard, pays Bob & Nima a visit to chat about her career, what makes her GoDaddy-esque and how she's looking forward to donning a Go Daddy-branded cap in the pool. In the Go Daddy LIVE Football Report, Chad Johnson talks about his team's scathing defeat on Monday night and why Ocho Cinco's end zone Go Daddy Dance didn't happen this time around. And in the Internet Files, Bob & his team take a look at the latest dot-com boom hitting Silicon Valley. Plus! Weird News makes its return in spectacular style!

item.title: The "Real" Founder of Facebook? & Ocho Cinco Joins the Cast
item.description: The "Real" Founder of Facebook? & Ocho Cinco Joins the Cast While at Harvard, he built a social network which, according to a widely circulated e-mail, included a feature called "the Face Book." 6 months later his classmate, Mark Zuckerberg launched Web 2.0 phenomenon Facebook. Tune in as guest Aaron Greenspan explains his "houseSystem" network and discusses who really came up with the idea for Facebook. In a brand-new fixture of the show, Go Daddy's newest spokesperson, Chad Johnson, joins Bob for the inaugural Go Daddy LIVE Football Report -- and promises an end zone Go Daddy Dance during next Monday's game. In the Internet Files, Bob & his team discuss whether Microsoft might buy a 5% stake in Facebook -- a move Bob likens to a kiss of death for Facebook.

item.title: Go Daddy LIVE Takes Off & Ocho Cinco Touches Down, Promises a Go Daddy Dance
item.description: In a gridiron special featuring Cincinatti's most GoDaddy-esque resident, Nima & Bob inaugurate the show's new name -- Go Daddy LIVE. Pro Football's edgy and slightly inappropriate top entertainer, "Ocho Cinco" alias Cincinatti WR Chad Johnson -- chats with Bob about his antics, the charities close to his heart, the possibility of doing a Go Daddy end zone dance, and the HOT new Go Daddy commercials he just shot. In the Internet Files, Bob & Co dissect Microsoft's® stinging defeat at the hands of an EU court and discuss Google's® $30 million bounty for landing a rover on the moon.

item.title: English 101 With Grammar Girl, College Ball, Wascally Wabbits and Yet Another Zune Rant
item.description: It's the show that puts hip back into English grammar and revives Warren's former alias - "thumbs." Nima & Bob discuss Go Daddy setting up shop in the Mile-High City, followed by Bob's BIG announcement of Go Daddy's sponsorship of ESPN College Football. Grammar Girl stops by to share some "Quick & Dirty Tips" from her podcast and -- inspired by Barry Bonds' bashing of Hank Aaron's home run record -- teach us how to use the asterisk to its full effect. In the Internet Files, Bob and his tech pundits ponder why Apple® cut the price on the iPhone® and whether the EU can preempt terror by banning bomb recipes from the Web. Also, Warner Bros unleashes Elmer Fudd, Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck on the Web and Bob delivers an epic tirade against Microsoft® and its "iPod Killer" - the Zune®. Plus, video of Warren & Bob -- our own "odd couple!"

item.title: Godaddying", Squidoo's New Take on Search & Trojans in Germany!
item.description: Our wordiest show ever adds a whole new lexicon to your life --- from "Godaddying" to "SquidWho." All-time favorite show guest, Seth Godin, returns to discuss his social network, Squidoo®, and why we should all become "Lensmasters" and donate our profits to charity. In the Internet Files, Brad rises from his couch to predict the end of social networking, while Bob & his expert panel discuss Apple's® golden touch, Bob's troublesome iPhone® text messaging and why Orkut®, despite its bizarre name, could soon rival Facebook® and Myspace®. Plus, Germans & Trojans & spies - oh my!

item.title: Twitter, Trivia & Exclusive Sturgis Video!
item.description: It's the show that never taps its toe in the bathroom. Bob is back to finally unveil the new name of your favorite Internet podcast--Go Daddy LIVE!--and reveals why, under different circumstances, his co-host might have been "Mandy" Jones. Next, Twitter co-founder Biz Stone explains how the mundane "away" IM status served as the inspiration for his Web 2.0 communications startup and discloses how it's caught on with at least two Democratic presidential hopefuls.
